name: Wilko Johnson
description:
'''John Andrew Wilkinson''' (12 July 1947 â€“ 21 November 2022), better known by the [[stage name]] '''Wilko Johnson''', was an English guitarist, singer, songwriter and occasional actor. He was a member of the [[Pub rock (United Kingdom)|pub rock]]/[[rhythm and blues]] band [[Dr. Feelgood (band)|Dr. Feelgood]] in the 1970s. Johnson was known for his distinctive guitar playing style, which he achieved by not using a [[plectrum]] but playing [[fingerstyle guitar|fingerstyle]]. This enabled him to play rhythm guitar and [[riff]]s or solos at the same time creating a highly percussive guitar sound.

Johnson and Dr. Feelgood were an influence on the English [[punk rock|punk]] movement. [[Paul Weller]] said of Johnson: "Wilko may not be as famous as some other guitarists, but he's right up there. And there are a lot of people who'll say the same. I can hear Wilko in lots of places. It's some legacy."

In 2011 and 2012 he appeared in the [[HBO]] fantasy series ''[[Game of Thrones]]'', as the mute executioner [[List of A Song of Ice and Fire characters#Ilyn Payne|Ser Ilyn Payne]].
